Tags: inconsistency-introduction-2 python inclusion class

InconsistencyIntroduction2Inclusion (python class)

See also

math concept | python declaration class | python sample

This section presents the InconsistencyIntroduction2Inclusion python class.

This class models the inclusion of the inconsistency-introduction-2 inference-rule in the target theory-elaboration-sequence.

Punctilious users do not need to instanciate objects from this class. In effect, the TheoryElaborationSequence class exposes the inconsistency_introduction_2 property, and instanciation is automatic when this property is accessed for the first time.

class core.InconsistencyIntroduction2Inclusion(t, echo=None, proof=None)
infer_formula(x_eq_y=None, x_neq_y=None, inconsistent_theory=None, t=None, echo=None)

Apply the inconsistency-introduction inference-rule and return the inferred-formula.
